thread.title: Lansing forfeits football game against Forks
thread.title_full: Lansing forfeits football game against Forks

title: Lansing forfeits football game against Forks
text:
Lansing forfeits football game against Forks 
By Travis Eldridge October 15, 2015 Updated Oct 15, 2015 at 6:58 PM EDT 
Town of Chenango, NY (WBNG Binghamton) For the second time in three weeks Chenango Forks does not have a football game to play this weekend. That's because Lansing has forfeited Friday night's game against the Blue Devils because of a lack of healthy players. 
This comes after Whitney Point forfeited against Forks two weeks ago. 
WBNG E-News - Sign Up For Our Newsletter! 
With those two games off the schedule, a quarter of Forks' regular season games have been cancelled. For some seniors on the team that's tough to swallow. 
"Especially for the seniors you know, it kind of hurts," said senior running back Cody Lamond. "We only have a limited amount of football games in our lives, to know we missed two of them is a little sad, but we'll get through it." 
"We're still trying to make the most of it, obviously," said head coach Dave Hogan. "You can control what you can control. We're still trying to have some fun, we're still trying to get better, it just makes it a little more challenging." 
According to Section IV football chairman David Garbarino, a team needs 16 healthy players to compete in a game. 
There have now been four forfeits in Section IV football this year. To submit a comment on this article, your email address is required. We respect your privacy and your email will not be visible to others nor will it be added to any email lists. Most Viewed
